title: Senior Software Engineer, Information Security
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...About Team: Decision AutomationAt Walmart, we prioritize innovation and data security. Our team is dedicated to maintaining a secure operating environment and preserving the trust of our customers, associates, and stakeholders. We combine a range of services and expertise to prevent fraud, detect threats, and manage digital risk and access. Our focus is on mitigating attack risks, securing cloud transformation, and fostering a culture of security and reliability within our team. The InfoSec Decision Automation (IDA) team delivers advanced, data-driven services to enable scalable, risk and compliance management for Walmart and its markets.What You'll DoDesign and Develop REST APIs and Micro-services for our Risk and Compliance functional area.Design and Develop data models both in SQL (MS SQL) and NoSQL (Cassandra, Graph DB)Develop solutions, frameworks, and tools for Risk and Compliance Domain (Vulnerability management, Compliance Reporting - PCI & SOX, Risk Management, and measurement) in the enterprise.Work across the entire vulnerability management ecosystem to manage effective and efficient data flow and exchange.You will work with security engineers, infrastructure teams, external teams, and partners in an agile manner to build and release product features that caters to business requirements.Use your knowledge of applicable technology stacks and platforms to automate Vulnerability management, Compliance Reporting - PCI & SOX, Risk Management, and measurement.You'll work to design and architect solutions to remove performance impacting barriers and increasing efficiency of our automation operations. title: Staff, Software Engineer
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...We are looking for a Staff Data Engineer to join our growing team of engineering experts in Finance Data Factory. The hire will be responsible for designing, architecting, building, expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture including helping to build new FDLH platform, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of re-designing our data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives.Create and maintain optimal data platform and pipeline architecture,Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability.Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and GCP 'big data' technologies.Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and GCP regions.Create data tools for analytics team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.About the Team: FDF - EngineeringEveryone has data, but the sheer volume of data at Walmart can be limitless. In the Finance Data Factory Engineering team, we help Walmart Finance manage this data by building pipelines and data lakes /warehouses to prepare big data for analysis and unlocking actionable insights. We also use cross-departmental and cross segment(Walmart, Sam's & International) data and machine learning to build a holistic view of true profitability, saving millions of dollars across item categories and geographies while assisting our leadership in making better decisions faster. Finance Data Factory - EngineeringWhat You'll BringAdvanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, Big Query, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.Experience building and optimizing 'big data' data pipelines, architectures and data sets.Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large, disconnected datasets.Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable 'big data' data stores.Strong project management and organizational skills.Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.We are looking for a candidate with 9+ Years of experience in a Data Engineer role, who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. They should also have experience using the following software/tools:Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Big Query, Cassandra.Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Airflow, etc.Experience with GCP cloud services: GCS, Dataproc, Dataplex, etc.Experience with stream-processing systems: Spark-Streaming, Storm etc.Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Scala.Experience in Designing new Data PlatformWell Versed with how Infra works with CodeStrong in NFRs, etc.About Walmart Global TechImagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. title: Frontend Software Engineer II
job_description: About The RoleWe're seeking a Frontend Software Engineer based in Fayetteville, AR. This Software Engineer will help determine the direction for solution methodology and delivery. They will provide oversight, regular assistance, and will directly manage developers. This position will have the opportunity to work on both current and new features to be deployed to a growing user base of hundreds of thousands. The ideal candidate will be comfortable ramping up quickly in order to create and maintain workflows that deliver value to our platform users. The Senior Software Engineer will be responsible for creating clean, scalable, standards-compliant, reusable, and quality code. In addition, they will contribute to the continuous growth and learning of the software development team and will manage a team of 3 front end engineers. Hiring the right person for this role is important to our team because they will be an integral part of the creation and continuous improvement of our products. title: Software Engineer - ArcBest Technologies
job_description: What You'll DoWho We AreArcBest Technologies, an ArcBest® company, is an innovative technology company that provides custom-built solutions and leading-edge technologies that help our customers and suppliers successfully navigate the complex supply chain landscape. Our team is made up of highly engaged and creative tech and analytical professionals — engineers, mathematicians, data scientists, software developers, information system specialists and more — who create smart solutions that deliver value to our customers and keep the global supply chain moving. We’re building the future of logistics.ArcBest Technologies is headquartered in Fort Smith, Arkansas.Our people are at the heart of our success, and we offer a workplace that embraces all cultures, perspectives, and experiences — so we can provide the best atmosphere for our employees and the best service to our customers. If that sounds like something you’d like to be a part of, we’d love to hear from you.Learn more about who ArcBest Technologies is and what we do along with ArcBest's commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion .What You’ll DoWe’re looking for a Software Engineer to join the ArcBest Technologies team. The Software Engineer designs, develops, and installs software solutions. This position builds high-quality, innovative, and fully performing software in compliance with coding standards and technical design and is responsible for development, writing code, and documenting functionality.Your Contribution May IncludeExecute full lifecycle software development.Write well-designed, testable, efficient code.Produce specifications and determine operational feasibility.Integrate software components into a fully functional software system.Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures.Document and maintain software functionality.Tailor and deploy software tools, processes, and metrics.Test solutions thoroughly to ensure reliable functionality prior to implementation.Serve as a subject matter expert.Comply with project plans and industry standards.Other duties and projects, as assigned.As a Software Engineer, you will be a member of the ArcBest Technologies Information Systems team in Fort Smith, AR. This position offers flexible work hours between 6:00 am – 6:00 pm, Monday – Friday with on call responsibilities and occasional irregular hours depending on workload. A flexible working schedule of nine-hour workdays with one day off every two weeks is available after six months of acceptable performance, subject to approval.Ready to apply? Before doing so, please make sure you meet the minimum requirements:EducationBachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, or relevant field.Equivalent experience will be considered in lieu of formal education.Experience8 years Prior experience as computer software engineer or software developer, preferred.Prior experience designing interactive applications and test-driven development.Proficient with software development methodology and release processes.Computer SkillsPrior experience developing applications using programming languages and/or frameworks such as C#, VB.Net, .NET, ASP.Net, JavaScript, Vue.js, HTML, CSS, etc.Experience with relational databases (DB2, SQL Server, etc.) and SQL.Experience of how to interact with API’s.Familiarity with z/OS mainframe technologies.Understanding of software development lifecycles.Experience implementing and building integrations with third-party software packages.Prior experience with agile and scrum methodologies.Growth mindset and a willingness to learn new skills, technologies, and frameworks.Additional RequirementsExcellent problem solving and analytical skills.If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to accommodation@arcb.com or call us at (479) 785-8717. title: (USA) Senior, Data Scientist
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...The Edge Ingress Security team is responsible for defending our eCommerce and corporate web properties from web-based attacks, DDoS attacks, unwanted scripted traffic, and fraudulent behavior.We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist to build end to end data infrastructure, pipeline, and machine learning models to detect and mitigate anomalous and fraudulent risks to Walmart web properties.About TeamAt Walmart, we prioritize innovation and data security. Our team is dedicated to maintaining a secure operating environment and preserving the trust of our customers, associates, and stakeholders. We combine a range of services and expertise to prevent fraud, detect threats, and manage digital risk and access. Our focus is on mitigating attack risks, securing cloud transformation, and fostering a culture of security and reliability within our teamWhat You'll DoYour main responsibilities include but are not limited to:Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architectureAssemble large, complex data setsAnalyze large volumes of data to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies indicative of fraudulent behavior. Derive data-driven insights to improve anomaly detection strategies.Build infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and 'big data' technologiesAssess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniquesDesign, develop and deploy custom data models and algorithms to surface anomalous behaviorsDevelop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracyWhat You'll Bring Have a passion for data with exceptional analytical and critical thinking skills  Well versed with Spark, Hadoop, Cloud, Python/Scala and Java, Streaming, Kafka.  Proven track record of at least one programming language and one Database language  Proficient in one of cloud computing platforms (e.g., GCP, Azure)  Experienced in data modeling & data migration protocols  Experience with data warehousing (e.g. Databricks)  Experience with machine learning algorithms and statistical techniques, with a focus on their use for anomaly detection  A strong sense of accountability and self-motivation  Ability to collaborate cross-functionally  Excellent communications skills both written and verbal.  Web application and cyber security domain knowledge is a plus. job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...Principal So f tware Engineer, Infrastructure Security - Audit compliance & Vulnerability Remediation, Benet on ville , AK , Sunnyvale, CA or Ruston, VAThe primary focus is to build automation around i nfrastructure security and vulnerability remediation. D esign , develop and maintain scalable tools to remediate vulnerabilities across operating systems, software applications, Databases, and v arious cloud (Azure/GCP) technologies .About TeamAt Walmart, we prioritize innovation and infrastructure security. title: Principal, Software Engineer
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...We are seeking a seasoned Principal, Software Engineer to join our Fintech team, dedicated to elevating reporting and analytics across diverse segments such as Walmart, Sam's Club, International, Corporate, and Enterprise. In this pivotal role, you will be at the forefront of transforming data into actionable insights that drive financial strategy and operational efficiency.About TeamOur team is focused on developing a streamlined, dependable company that includes service operations and technology solutions for Finance, People, and Associate Digital Experience (ADE). We also provide a variety of services such as procurement, supplier portfolio management, merchandising master data, and analytics. From developing HR chatbots and virtual assistants to creating invoice solutions and facilitating legal changes, we help drive efficiency across Walmart globally.What You'll DoAdvanced Power BI Development: Lead the design and development of innovative Power BI solutions for complex business intelligence challenges.Modeling Excellence: Pioneer advanced PBI Semantic Models utilizing cutting-edge modeling strategies and methodologies to handle large-scale data efficiently.Expert Data Manipulation: Master the use of Power Query and M language for sophisticated data transformations and manipulation.Advanced DAX Programming: Craft complex DAX measures for nuanced fact calculations, enabling powerful and efficient data visualization in Power BI.Performance Optimization: Strategize and optimize tabular models and Power BI report performances, ensuring scalability and speed.Visualization Standards: Set and enforce high standards for developed visualizations, ensuring adherence to company branding and design principles.Technical Leadership: Guide and mentor, a team of engineers, conducting code reviews and leading design discussions to ensure engineering best practices.Software Craftsmanship: Consistently produce high-quality software with a focus on unit testing, regular code reviews, and continuous integration.Technical Documentation: Develop comprehensive technical documentation and presentations to clearly communicate architectural decisions and design options.Environment Management: Oversee multiple production and non-production environments, ensuring alignment with engineering standards.Engineering Advocacy: Promote and enforce technical standards across the organization to achieve concrete outcomes and drive engineering excellence.Strategic Project Leadership: Lead the discovery phase of major projects, ensuring the design aligns with business goals and technical requirements.What You'll BringAs a thought leader, you will harness the power of Power BI to build and scale advanced analytical models, ensuring our financial reporting not only meets but exceeds industry standards.Your technical acumen and deep understanding of financial domains will enable you to create robust, dynamic BI solutions that resonate with stakeholders from various segments of the business.The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of engineering excellence, a passion for data-driven decision-making, and the ability to synthesize complex data sets into clear, impactful financial narratives.By fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement, you will empower the Fintech team to deliver cutting-edge analytics that inform critical business decisions and promote sustained growth.This role is designed for a leader who is adept at navigating the cross-functional dynamics of a multinational corporation while pushing the boundaries of what's possible with BI technology.Your expertise will not only drive the success of our financial reporting and analytics but also lay the groundwork for future advancements in our Fintech capabilities.About Walmart Global TechImagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That's what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We're a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world's leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. job_description: Vive Financial is currently hiring a Senior Software Engineer to work with a team of Engineers to provide stable, high-quality, and scalable solutions that meet the needs of the business. This will also include providing enhancements to current applications, maintaining the existing code base, increasing velocity, and working within our change procedures to fulfill current compliance requirements.This position is eligible for remote work with some days in the office in our Fayetteville, Arkansas location. Candidate must live within a 60-mile radius of Fayetteville, Arkansas. languages and platforms not limited to Java, HTML, C#, VB.net, ASP.net, .Net Core, Unity, etc.Work with users and product owners to clarify needs and resolve issuesFollow established software engineering standards and best practicesTest and debug code for quality assurance and problem resolutionAssist the QA team in developing a plan to test new functionality and featuresOwn projects from inception to completion including documenting implementation plans and meeting core business needsAssist in after-hours software engineering support and system releasesQuickly plan and reverse implementations when issues occur using Azure DevOps, YAML pipelines for releasesApply an advanced level of knowledge in MS SQL Server utilizing T-SQL, stored procedures and transaction processing We champion being a collaborative health care organization, focused on improving patient care and the lives of Arkansans.UAMS offers amazing benefits and perks (available for benefits eligible positions only):Health: Medical, Dental and Vision plans available for qualifying staff and familyHoliday, Vacation and Sick LeaveEducation discount for staff and dependents (undergraduate only)Retirement: Up to 10% matched contribution from UAMSBasic Life Insurance up to $50,000Career Training and Educational OpportunitiesMerchant DiscountsConcierge prescription delivery on the main campus when using UAMS pharmacyBelow you will find the details for the position including any supplementary documentation and questions you should review before applying for the opening. To apply for the position, please click the Apply link/button.The University of Arkansas is an equal opportunity, affirmative action institution. The University does not discriminate in its education programs or activities (including in admission and employment) on the basis of age, race, color, national origin, disability, religion, marital or parental status, protected veteran status, military service, genetic information, or sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity). Federal law prohibits the University from discriminating on these bases. Questions or concerns about the application of Title IX, which prohibits discrimination on the basis of sex, may be sent to the University's Title IX Coordinator and to the U.S. Department of Education Office for Civil Rights.Persons must have proof of legal authority to work in the United States on the first day of employment.All application information is subject to public disclosure under the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act.At UAMS we value Diversity, Equity and Inclusion.For general application assistance or if you have questions about a job posting, please contact Human Resources at askrecruitment@uams.edu.Department:ACHI | AnalyticsDepartment's Website:Summary of Job Duties:The Senior Data Analyst will be part of a dynamic team contributing to and providing internal leadership on analytic research projects for ACHI’s policy efforts. In collaboration with the Director of Research and Evaluation, the Assistant Director of Analytics, principal investigators, and other ACHI staff, the Senior Data Analyst will develop and implement advanced data and statistical analytics using private and public healthcare claims data and other health data to inform research on important health policy questions, as well as cost and quality comparative studies for the State of Arkansas.The position requires the ability to manipulate medical claims data, including data from an all-payer claims database, multiple large public and private health data sources, and numerous other data sources.Qualifications:Minimum Qualifications:Master's Degree in health services research, statistics, mathematics, computer science or health policy/economics or related field. Three (3) years of experience conducting statistical programming on large datasets. Data management with large, administrative datasets including healthcare claims data. Manipulation of large datasets using advanced data management and statistical software such as SAS or SQL; experience using both would be preferred. Use of advanced SAS functions to manipulate dates to create time -dependent analytical variables. Use of statistical techniques, including univariate statistics, comparisons, and regression modeling, and Application, calculation and interpretation of descriptive and inferential data. Preferred Qualifications:Healthcare cost and use analysesKnowledge and use of trusted national data sources (e.g., ACS, HCUP, MEPS). Health services research, such as healthcare quality, Medicaid eligibility, Medicaid/Medicare claims, health disparities, or chronic diseases. CPT, ICD-9 Procedure, ICD-9 Diagnosis, HCPCS, DRG/MS-DRG, NDC, Type of Service, Place of Service, and other codes commonly utilized in healthcare data sets. Knowledge of ArcGIS or other geographical coding programs to assist in health geocoding/mappingAdditional Information:Key Responsibilities:Develop complex and efficient data analytic and statistical programs to manipulate healthcare data to create research-ready datasets for empirical analyses. Import and longitudinally cross-link data from a variety of sources to develop research-ready analytic datasets. Import and integrate large, complex datasets using SAS, including administrative claims data and enrollment files from a variety of insurance payers. Execute basic descriptive and inferential statistical analyses. Communicate and collaborate with the Director of Research and Evaluation and the Assistant Director of Analytics on translating policy questions into initial analytic plans based on policy questions. Communicate and collaborate with project teams made up of other staff who possess data, policy, and other skillsets. Create written data analytic plans with detailed data management procedures to transform raw healthcare data into research-ready analytic datasets. Write methodological components of technical reports following accepted protocols. Maintain detailed programming documentation for all projects, including annotated program code, dataset codebooks, and statistical output. Identify relevant background information to inform analytic plans designed to answer policy-related questions. Identify new techniques and approaches to enhance current or future analytic reporting. Salary Information:Commensurate with education and experienceRequired Documents to Apply:Cover Letter/Letter of Application, License or Certificate (see special instructions for submission instructions), List of three Professional References (name, email, business title), ResumeOptional Documents:Proof of Veteran StatusSpecial Instructions to Applicants:Recruitment Contact Information:Please contact askrecruitment@uams.edu for any recruiting related questions.All application materials must be uploaded to the University of Arkansas System Career Site https://uasys.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/UASYS Please do not send to listed recruitment contact.Pre-employment Screening Requirements:Criminal Background CheckThis position is subject to pre-employment screening (criminal background, drug testing, and/or education verification). A criminal conviction or arrest pending adjudication alone shall not disqualify an applicant except as provided by law. Any criminal history will be evaluated in relationship to job responsibilities and business necessity. The information obtained in these reports will be used in a confidential, non-discriminatory manner consistent with state and federal law.Constant Physical Activity:Hearing, Manipulate items with fingers, including keyboarding, Sitting, StandingFrequent Physical Activity:Talking, WalkingOccasional Physical Activity:Pulling, Pushing, Reaching, WalkingBenefits Eligible:Yes

title: (USA) Staff, Software Engineer - UI/UX
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...In the role of Staff Software Engineer you will collaborate with a talented group of frontend engineers to develop a seamless checkout experience. developing software solutions.Lead the design, architecture and reviews.Work on optimizing the products on Cloud Infra, cost, performance etc.Documenting and recording every aspect of an application title: Data Scientist III
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...About Our TeamThe Walmart Omni Tech Supply Chain Innovation team researches, identifies, and develops analytical supply chain products that drive cost efficiencies. Our team takes end-to-end ownership in solving complex supply chain problems using technology and data. We're seeking motivated, results-oriented individuals to build innovative products, from concept to deployment.What You'll DoAs a Data Scientist III in Global Tech, you will work with cross-functional teams of engineers, designers, and product managers to build products. You will:Conceptualize, research, and identify gaps in current business processes. Structure ambiguous problems, formulate hypotheses, gather and analyze data, and provide clear recommendations using tools such as BigQuery, Microsoft Power BI, Excel, R, PythonBuild scalable and complex supply chain models and processes to optimize supply chain.Lead the data discovery for complex technical projects while navigating multiple data sourcesDemonstrate a high degree of creativity when developing solutions to improve existing supply chain processes, utilizing methods such as statistical analysis, and optimization.Work effectively with diverse teams to come up with the best solutions and move people and organizations to act.What You'll Bring (Skills Required)Knowledge of retail supply chain and one or more business practices across domains such as product, finance, marketing, technology, business systems.Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills. Experience with large dataset mining tools and open-source programming tools (e.g., R, Python).Experience solving network / inventory / transportation optimization problems using integer. Programming.Ability to deconstruct an abstract problem, formulate hypotheses, identify the right-metrics and data sources and conduct detailed analyses to explain the business context.Experience in navigating ambiguity and building rapid business cases/ prototypes to improve business performance.Hands-on experience in conducting advanced analyses to provide recommendation of applicability and efficiency of product features.Experience using the following analytics and reporting tools: Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery), Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft Excel. About Walmart Global TechImagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people and put a smile on their face. That's what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We're a team of 15,000+ software engineers, data scientists and service professionals within Walmart, the world's largest retailer, delivering innovations that improve how our customers shop and empower our 2.3 million associates. To others, innovation looks like an app, service, or some code, but Walmart has always been about people. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. title: Staff, Software Engineer - React/ReactNative
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...About Team: People TechnologyIt's an exciting time to join our Walmart journey. Want to use design and coding skills to solve real-life large-scale problems impacting millions of lives?We are seeking a Staff Software Engineer - React/ReactNative for a key position within People Technology organization to deliver associate centric people experiences.We are embracing Open-Source technology using React-Native, React.js to build mobile and web experiences and cloud native backend services using Java and GraphQL. In our team, you will work with talented engineers across our platforms including mobile engineers, backend service engineers, UX Designers and product managers to shape our road map for Integrated People Experiences to delight our users.What you'll do... Design solutions such that the processes/applications work in tandem for specific components/modules of a product. Evaluate trade-offs while designing a component based on the business requirements. Assist in conversion of HLD (High Level Design) to create detailed design using mock screens, pseudo codes and detailed functional logic of the modules for specific modules/components of a product.  Select appropriate frameworks, platforms, and environments for software coding/configuration and scripting. Guide the team on coding patterns, languages, and frameworks in line with evolving trends in the industry (Ex: reactive vs. imperative etc.) and drive scalability and security.  Support ad-hoc reviews of software code to ensure baseline mitigations for known risks. Create/configure minimalistic code for entire product/system and ensure the product is meeting business requirements, non-functional requirements, low-maintainability, high-availability, and high-scalability needs. Oversee the codes executed by team in line with specified technical/business requirements.  Select appropriate frameworks, platforms, and environments for software coding/configuration and scripting. Guide the team on coding patterns, languages, and frameworks in line with evolving trends in the industry (Ex: reactive vs. imperative etc.) and drive scalability and security. Drive implementation of telemetry features by determining data/metrics requirement within the domain  Support ad-hoc reviews of software code to ensure baseline mitigations for known risks. Create/configure minimalistic code for entire product/system and ensure the product is meeting business requirements, non-functional requirements, low-maintainability, high-availability, and high-scalability needs. Oversee the codes executed by team in line with specified technical/business requirements. Arrange project requirements in programming sequence by analyzing requirements.  Drive creation of scripts for automation of repetitive and routine tasks in CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery), testing or any other process across the domain. Conduct code reviews for code developed by the team. Drive security of the Code Base and ensure that no security violations are introduced.  Translate customer requirements into test strategy. Determine the testing tools (E.g. - Automation - Selenium, Agile - Jira, Mobile - Eggplant etc.), domains, environments, and test types to be employed to achieve testing objectives. Select, introduce, and implement various tools for testing. Identify scope and method of testing for each requirement. Ensure that the test cases cover all the test scenarios (E.g., for functionality, performance, security, integration, data migration and accessibility) for the product/solution requirements. Drive execution of test cases to test the code and detect errors and defects for the entire product.  Explore relevant products/solutions from an existing repertoire, which can address business/technical needs. Assess gaps/updates/modifications between the customer/business expectations and the existing product/solutions (in case of agile methodology, for the iteration). Classify the requirements into applicable types (for example - Functional/Non-Functional, Derived/Imposed/Emergent etc.), anticipate the solution risks/issues during requirements gathering phase, inform relevant stakeholders and recommend corrective steps. Contribute to the creation of user stories for component/application/complex (for agile methodology)  Monitor and evaluate the progress of the projects against approved milestones and timelines. Provide inputs to relevant stakeholders regarding schedule progress, health, issues/risks, and key dependencies. Provide inputs to relevant stakeholder for creation of project plans. Ensure adherence to the CICD process as per identified schedule.  Track and analyze defects for the component/module and carry out regression testing to fix defects in all instances of code changes. Analyze defects from past projects/solutions to avoid recurrence of similar defects. Troubleshoot performance and availability bottlenecks for the application.  Conduct complex maintenance procedures for applications independently. Monitor and evaluate the performance of the application by tracking and analyzing appropriate metrics; Perform maintenance (corrective, adaptive, perfective) and re-engineering activities. Analyze application logs, maintenance activity data, performance data and provide analysis. Evaluate change requests to identify those which are valid and feasible.  Drive the execution of multiple business plans and projects by identifying customer and operational needs; develop and communicate business plans and priorities; remove barriers and obstacles that impact performance; provide resources; identify performance standards; measure progress and adjust performance; accordingly, develop contingency plans; and demonstrate adaptability and support continuous learning.  Provide supervision and development opportunities for associates by selecting and training; mentoring; assigning duties; building a team-based work environment; establish performance expectations and conducting regular performance evaluations; provide recognition and rewards; coach for success and improvement; and ensure diversity awareness.  Promote and support company policies, procedures, mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity by training and providing direction to others in their use and application; ensuring compliance with them; and utilizing and supporting the Open Door Policy  Ensure business needs are being met by evaluating the ongoing effectiveness of current plans, programs, and initiatives; consult with business partners, managers, co-workers, or other key stakeholders; solicit, evaluate, and apply suggestions for improving efficiency and cost-effectiveness; and participate in and support community outreach events. What you'll bring... 10+ years of experience in architecting and developing mobile & web applications.  Strong expertise in front-end architecture, distributed systems, scalability, design patterns, disaster recovery, detailed design coding standards and guidelines  Strong expertise in frontend development using React, ReactNative and Redux  Strong expertise in frameworks like Cocoa, Android application framework, etc. and platforms like Apple iOS, Android, Microsoft Azure, etc.  Solid understanding of Quality, Safety and Security (PCI etc.) standards, emerging tools and technologies, telemetry, CI/CD, Code Management Tools and SDLC  Strong expertise in integrating analytics, crashlytics and profiling mobile and web apps.  Strong expertise in architecting automation frameworks for testing mobile and web applications.  Solid understanding of GraphQL and REST APIs  Clear Communication, including the ability to create functional charts.  Ability to multitask between several different requirements and features concurrently. Have a true passion about Technology. It's a must!  Nice to have Backend experience either Java or nodeJs development. title: Power System Operations Engineer I, II
job_description: MISO offers a comprehensive benefits package available on your first day of employment.Position Location: Little Rock, ARAre you an electrical engineer looking to make an impact in a control room that oversees the reliable operations of an electric grid serving 45 million people?Do you have interest in working in a fast-paced environment where you will be interacting with a cross-section of internal and external groups, to ensure reliable and efficient delivery of electricity?Do you want to help manage the ever-evolving Eastern Interconnect through the paradigm changes of decarbonization, digitization, and decentralization?If so, read on…As our Power System Operations Engineer I, II, you will be part of MISO’s Real Time Operations group…where the “rubber meets the road.” Our operators and engineers work collaboratively to make complex and quick decisions. This team coordinates the use of the transmission system by ensuring flows stay within prescribed limits and partners with transmission operators and neighboring reliability coordinators to maintain reliability.As the Power System Operations Engineer I, II, you will be part of the team that works collaboratively with Reliability Coordinators and our stakeholders to enable reliable delivery of low-cost energy.You will also be responsible for working on engineering study automation projects, innovative engineering solutions for operations of the future and cross functional collaborative projects.In one year as our Power System Operations Engineer I, II, you will know you were successful if you have a basic understanding of the MISO footprint, the suite of real time engineering tools and have established relationships with operators and external/internal stakeholders.We are looking for hardworking engineers who have: At least a Bachelor’s degree in any of the following:Electrical EngineeringComputer EngineeringElectrical Engineering TechnologyElectrical and Computer EngineeringElectrical and Electronic EngineeringElectronics and Computer Engineering Technology T he ability and willingness to work a 12-hour rotating shift scheduleWe would also prefer engineers with the following: Utility, transmission operations, real-time operations, or related experience Transient/Voltage stability experienceAppropriate level will be determined based upon experience and knowledge.See what MISO is all about!MISO manages the electricity superhighway in the Central U.S. Through use of groundbreaking research and advanced technology, our highly skilled employees ensure power flows reliably to 45 million people. Operating the electricity grid, running a robust energy market, planning for a bright future – it’s what our immensely talented and dedicated team does every day.For more info about MISO, check us out on YouTubeMISO 90 SecondsApply today for this great opportunity to help us keep the lights on!

title: (USA) Principal, Software Engineer
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...The Associate Digital Experience (ADE) mission is to deliver business value through consumer-grade products and services; building trust through transparency, reducing our operational costs; and reinvesting into experienced-based outcomes which enable radical flexibility for the evolving digital workforce. It builds, owns, and operates a number of internal and external tools that help our associates (what Walmart calls its employees) work better and collaborate more. This specific role is on ADE's Campus Technology team whose vision is to power the world's most user-friendly campus experience.About TeamThe Enterprise People Technology team supports the successful deployment and adoption of new People technology across the enterprise. As a Fortune #1 company, our work impacts millions of associates globally. We strive to continuously improve people technology and products to help managers and associates so they can focus on what matters most - supporting our customers and members. People Technology is one of the major segments of Walmart Global Tech's Enterprise Business Services, which is invested in building a compact, robust organization that includes service operations and technology solutions for Finance, People, and the Associate Digital Experience.What You'll DoAs a Software Developer, you'll work independently and guide small groups of two to three engineers, including offshore associates, for assigned engineering projects including new products, features, and proof-of-concepts.You'll help our team by reviewing project requirements, translating them into technical solutions, writing and developing code, conducting/creating relevant testing, communicating status and issues to team members and partners, and ensuring on-time delivery. You'll frequently collaborate with the product team, cross-functional partners, Architecture leads, as well as UX Designers and Researchers. title: (USA) Staff, Software Engineer - Content Management
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...Overall, your role as a Staff, Software Engineer supporting Adobe Experience Manager would involve a combination of technical leadership, solution design, development, integration, and maintenance activities aimed at delivering scalable, robust, and user-friendly digital experiences for the organization. You will help in driving the successful implementation, optimization, and maintenance of AEM-based solutions.Must be self managing and able to use engineering data to independently make decisions that further compliance with enterprise goals Design and develop scalable solutions that fit product needs.Be leader by providing technical and architectural direction.Be able to review and understand product/business requirements and translate them into technical solution. Participate alongside product/project management in requirements gathering and writing processes. Drive highly visible projects across the organization.About The TeamThe Enterprise People Technology team supports the successful deployment and adoption of new People technology across the enterprise. As a Fortune #1 company, our work impacts millions of associates globally. We strive to continuously improve people technology and products to help managers and associates so they can focus on what matters most - supporting our customers and members. People Technology is one of the major segments of Walmart Global Tech's Enterprise Business Services, which is invested in building a compact, robust organization that includes service operations and technology solutions for Finance, People, and the Associate Digital Experience.What You'll BringRequired Technical Skills: Java, HTML, CSS, JS, ReactJS, Adobe Experience Manager, Apache Jackrabbit Oak, Apache Felix, Apache Sling, SQL, Cypress, Selenium, GitPreferred Skills: Azure, Google Cloud Platform, Linux, Elastic Search, Docker, SplunkLeadership Skills: Experience leading dispersed development teams; Experience using JIRA & familiarity with scrum framework; Experience interacting with and developing upon content management systems; Strong expertise in algorithms and data structures and able to provide guidance on both concepts to junior developers.About Walmart Global TechImagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That's what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We're a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world's leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. title: Forecasting Analyst
job_description: Company DescriptionHana Group is a multinational company leading sales in pan-Asian cuisine sold in grocery retailers and commerce marketplaces. The company has tailored brands providing custom collaborations to our partners and to our consumers. Through our distribution company, we are able to deliver on our mission of sustainable sourcing with ingredients that make our food healthy, delicious, and affordable. We aim to CARE about the quality of our service, to ACT to deliver new concepts for finding pan-Asian cuisine, to DARE to deliver sushi and more in new ways to our consumers, and to TRUST in our ability to follow through on customer expectations. We participate in E-Verify and we are an Equal Opportunity Employer.Job DescriptionThe Forecasting Analyst is a key member of the sales and operations team, responsible for analyzing sales trends, historical data, and client insights to develop accurate sales forecasts and optimize product assortments at the kiosk level. Utilizing Adoria and other analytical tools, the Forecasting Analyst will ensure each kiosk is prepared to meet daily sales demands with an efficient product mix, minimizing waste and maximizing sales. This role involves close collaboration with clients to adjust forecasts for special events and marketing campaigns, and continuous improvement of forecasting models based on actual sales outcomes and feedback.Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain advanced forecasting models using sales trends, historical data, and input from clients to predict daily sales at each kiosk. Collaborate with clients to incorporate key events, promotions, and marketing campaigns into sales forecasts. Analyze product performance, waste levels, and customer preferences to recommend adjustments to product assortments, ensuring each kiosk meets its sales potential with minimal waste. Use Adoria software to update and manage product assortments, ensuring accurate and efficient production planning at the kiosk level. Regularly review and adjust forecasts based on actual sales outcomes, seasonal variations, and market trends to continually improve accuracy and efficiency. Work closely with the National Sales Director to develop sales targets and strategies that align with company goals and market opportunities. Prepare and present detailed reports and analyses on sales forecasts, actual sales performance, and assortment optimization efforts to senior management and clients. Serve as the primary point of contact for sales and operations teams for all matters related to sales forecasting and product assortment planning. Stay abreast of industry trends, technological advancements, and best practices in forecasting and inventory management to drive continuous improvement. QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Statistics, Business, Economics, or related field. Minimum of 3 years of experience in sales forecasting, inventory management, or a related analytical role, preferably in a retail or kiosk-based business environment. Proficiency in Power BI and strong Excel skills. Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain accurate forecasting models and to use data analysis for decision making. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with clients and across functional teams. Strong organizational and project management abilities, with a keen attention to detail. Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage time effectively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. Skills:Advanced analytical and quantitative skillsStrong problem-solving and decision-making capabilitiesEffective communication and presentation skillsDetail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and efficiencyProactive and results-driven mindsetAdditional InformationHana Group North America is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Data Scientist III

You will be responsible for analyzing large data sets, developing predictive and simulation models, and implementing data-driven solutions to optimize our supply chain operations.About TeamSam's Club is our membership warehouse club, a business model that provides our members with high-quality products at prices that are unrivaled by traditional retail. Sam's Club provides a carefully curated assortment of items, as well as developing and leading technologies and services such as Scan & Go, Club Pickup, and home delivery service in select markets. title: Data Scientist- Machine Learning
job_description: Priority1 strives to go beyond simply offering jobs. We foster careers by creating a great working environment for our team members. We hire talented individuals who will provide the best support and can quickly adapt to the rapidly changing world of logistics. These talented men and women drive our business, and we are committed to their success.Priority1, a privately held third-party logistics company, is looking to hire a talented data scientist to join a growing team responsible for the development of a transportation and logistics technology platform.Ideal candidates will be diligent in problem solving, dedicated to the quality of their work, skilled in one or more required technologies, and overall versatile. Qualified candidates have demonstrated experience working in small, agile development teams responsible for the delivery of web-based solutions. They will have experience with all aspects of application development ranging from design, development, testing, and support.Required Skills & ExperienceDesign, develop, and deploy AI/ML solutions aligned with our company vision. Build predictive models and make data-driven predictions or recommendations. Leverage statistical analysis, machine learning, and data mining techniques to extract insights from data and drive data-driven decision making. Present findings and insights through data visualizations, reports, and presentations. Effectively communicate complex analytical concepts to stakeholders. Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their objectives, challenges, and requirements. Translate business questions into analytical problems and define clear goals for data analysis projects. Proficiency in using one or more programming or scripting languages to work with data such as: Python, Perl, R, or C#. Engineering experience using large data systems on SQL, Hadoop, etc. Some experience and or project course work performing data analysis and applying statistics working with tools such as: Excel, R, MATLAB, AMPL, or SAS. As a rapidly growing leader in the electrical service industry, we're committed to leveraging data-driven decisions to enhance our performance and drive innovation.Job Description:As an Entry-Level Data Administrator/Analyst, you'll play a crucial role in our data-driven journey. You'll work closely with our operations team to gather, analyze, and interpret complex data sets. Your insights will directly influence strategic decisions and contribute to the overall success of the company.Responsibilities:Input daily team KPI’s to assist operations managers.Input payroll daily / weekly to assist operations managers.Batch & Post Invoices & PO’s daily to assist operations managers.Collaborate with operations & accounting teams to identify data requirements and sources.Clean, preprocess, and validate data to ensure accuracy and reliability.Perform exploratory data analysis to discover trends, patterns, and outliers.Assist in creating visually engaging reports and dashboards for stakeholders.Contribute to the development of data models and analytical frameworks.Support the implementation of data-driven strategies to optimize business processes.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in a relevant field preferred but not mandatory (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, etc.).Proficient with ExcelStrong analytical mindset and a passion for working with data.Excellent communication skills to convey complex findings effectively.Detail-oriented with a commitment to producing high-quality, accurate work.Ability to thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.Why Join Us:Opportunity to work in a dynamic and with an innovative team .Hands-on experience in a supportive and growth-focused environment.Chance to contribute meaningfully to impactful projects.Competitive compensation and benefits package.Benefits:Medical, Dental, Vision401K with MatchingPaid VacationPaid Family DaysPaid HolidaysCompensation: $18.00 - title: (USA) Senior, Software Engineer- SAP SuccessFactors
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...Do you dream of creating innovative systems and products that make a big impact to more than 2 million users across the globe? Y ou will play a pivotal role in designing, developing, and implementing digital solutions that solve mission critical business problems in supporting Walmart's Workforce Enablement systems.Join our dynamic and forward-thinking People Technology engineering organization. As a Senior Solution Consultant, you will be responsible for technical feasibility in the implementation from conception to system configuration and integration of SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central module. y ou will be part of the transformative projects and foundational improvements of Walmart's Workforce Enablement systems globally.About TeamThe Enterprise People Technology team supports the successful deployment and adoption of new People technology across the enterprise. As a Fortune #1 company, our work impacts millions of associates globally. We strive to continuously improve people technology and products to help managers and associates so they can focus on what matters most - supporting our customers and members. People Technology is one of the major segments of Walmart Global Tech's Enterprise Business Services, which is invested in building a compact, robust organization that includes service operations and technology solutions for Finance, People, and the Associate Digital Experience.What You'll Do Execution of necessary configurations in SucessFactors according to the concept. Cooperation in business workshops and the preparation of results Participation in Fit2Standard workshops to specify the desired innovations or new release functions. Work with the business teams / product owners to identify their requirements, design and develop/enhance functionalities to help meet business requirements in SuccessFactors Employee Central, PMGM, Talent & Succession and Cloud Integrations. Work with the user community to determine the best solution to help resolve customer problems and satisfy customer requirements. Collaborate with technical developers to develop and test new interface changes and enhancements to existing interfaces. Perform thorough testing through various testing cycles to deliver accurate solution. Performs configuration work as needed to support new and existing functionality. Responsible for creating configuration workbooks and developing high quality solutions. Responsible for reviewing the unit test plans and the quality assurance plans to ensure all requirements have been met. Perform integration testing work as necessary to ensure that new functionality or enhancements do not adversely affect existing functionality. Resolve configuration, access, data, Reporting and Integrations related issues. Provide oversight to various Projects and change requests to assess overall impact Utilize Agile project methodology during each phase of the implementation. Follow all design work and integration testing protocols, change control procedures, uses company standards, procedures, and practices in performing required work. Analyze current business processes and make recommendations.What You'll Bring Good business knowledge of various HR processes and Talent management processes. Must be able to translate client business needs to technical business requirements. Must possess strong analytical skills. Experience in XML for data model configuration and provisioning. Strong understanding of Employee Central Data models like Succession data models, Corporate Data models and MDFs, propagation data models. Strong expertise in Picklists management, Role Based Permissions, Organization, Pay & Job Structures Management, Country Specific Fields (CSF) customization, Self Service (MSS / ESS) Transactions Configuration, Workflow Configuration, EC Position Management, MDF Objects Configuration, business rules configurations. Having knowledge on EC Payroll and Compensation is a plus. Retail domain knowledge and specifically international exposure is preferred. Expertise in a proposing the solutions to business. Must have good experience in designing the functional and technical solutions. Good experience in building reports using ORD and Ad-hoc Reports. Should be able to analyse the Half yearly release and update the system with the required features by creating a test strategy and test plan. Experience with data migration and data management activities in SF. Expertise in Cloud Integrations: Experience in integrating SuccessFactors with other 3 rd party systems/applications, using BTP platform. Should posses' strong knowledge on oData APIs for 3 rd party integrations. Understanding of CI/CD concepts and drive automations in SuccessFactors applications Change management: drive change impact assessments, communication plans, and end-user training. Experience in Project Management with SAP Activate methodology . Good understanding of incident management and change management processes. SAP SuccessFactors Implementation in reputed global organization. 8+ years of experience in implementation / application enhancement /production support/ projects in SAP SuccessFactors/ SAP HR. Minimum experience of 3+ implementation projects. Should have valid Associate level certification and completed delta exam in SuccessFactors Employee Central Knowledge and hands-on experience across SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central with SAP Activate methodology . Must have hands-on knowledge and experience on support tools - Service Now, JIRA. Effective business communication and stakeholder management skills. title: Sr Analyst Data Governance (On-site)
job_description: Job Details:What is Tyson Enterprise Data Management?The Enterprise Data Management Team at Tyson Foods is building data capabilities of the future that will assist in the transformation of an 85-year-old company into the most modern food company in the world. We are developing master data management, governance and quality processes that will ensure data throughout the organization and around the globe is complete, valid, and accurate. We are building analytics governance capabilities that are changing the way this company views and utilizes data to help drive our business forward. At Tyson Foods we are driving world class data management, governance, and quality practices to revolutionize a world class company.How can I be part of Enterprise Data Management @ Tyson?Reporting directly to the Enterprise Data Management Director, you will be responsible for ensuring data excellence for data within our analytics platform. You will partner with data stewards from all domains to ensure that data created in the platform is properly cataloged in our Data & Report Catalogs and enriched with business relevant context. You will work closely with the data modelers and other Data & Analytics team members to provide steward guidance on analytic builds. You will monitor the adherence to security and data classification standards and champion the understanding of the standards with other domain stewards. As we continue to build out our data governance processes with the analytics landscape, you will play a key role in executing the governance tasks to ensure our analytics builds are accurate, understood, and secure. title: (USA) Senior, Software Engineer - SAP Payroll Functional Config Expert
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...We are seeking an experienced SAP HCM Payroll Functional expert to join our Payroll Tech team. The ideal candidate should have a minimum of 2-3 end-to-end SAP Payroll implementations including at least one large scale end-to-end SAP Payroll implementation. In this role, you will play a crucial part in the largest-ever payroll implementation.About TeamThe Enterprise People Technology team supports the successful deployment and adoption of new People technology across the enterprise. As a Fortune #1 company, our work impacts millions of associates globally. We strive to continuously improve people technology and products to help managers and associates so they can focus on what matters most - supporting our customers and members. People Technology is one of the major segments of Walmart Global Tech's Enterprise Business Services, which is invested in building a compact, robust organization that includes service operations and technology solutions for Finance, People, and the Associate Digital Experience.What You'll Do Your responsibilities will include translating requirements into technical solutions, gathering necessary information, such as design documents and product requirements, and SAP payroll config. You will also conduct unit testing, communicate status and issues to team members and stakeholders, collaborate with project and cross-functional teams, troubleshoot open issues and bug-fixes, ensure on-time delivery and hand-offs, and provide leadership to the project team. Your role will involve SAP Payroll configuration, reviews, troubleshooting data and config issues by gathering information, issue resolution, conducting root cause analysis, unit testing and completing necessary documentation. Develop high-quality, scalable, performance-effective and customer-centric solutions in SAP payroll for the US and Canada. Perform hands-on configuration (customizing) work to support new and existing functionality. Serve as the resident team expert for SAP Payroll configuration issues in both support and new implementations. Design and review configuration and functional specifications, collaborating with ABAP HR developers to develop and test significant new functionality and enhancements. Create and execute unit test scenarios for quality assurance activities to ensure all requirements are met. Analyze current business processes and make recommendations for leveraging standard SAP product capabilities. Assist in the technical preparation of Test Scenarios, and End-user documentation. Additionally, you will provide support to the payroll business, developers & test automation engineers by addressing inquiries, concerns, and issues. This includes assessing technical feasibility, developing implementation strategies, identifying short and long-term solutions, facilitating resolutions, and leading cross-functional partnerships. Furthermore, you will take the lead in the discovery phase of medium to large projects. This includes collaborating with the SAP product team, project management, payroll business, and automation teams to develop high-level designs and obtain cross-functional approvals. Collaborate with business users and process owners to identify requirements, design enhancements, and functionality to meet payroll business needs. Facilitate problem-solving discussions with the business, internal teams, and project managers to resolve issues and maintain project continuity and requirements.In summary, you will demonstrate expertise in developing and executing action plans, test automaton, support the implementation of business solutions, model compliance with company policies and procedures, and ensure successful delivery of Payroll with a focus on architectural qualities. Your role will involve extensive collaboration with internal and external stakeholders, coaching on appropriate solutions, and driving efficient technical solution design.What You'll BringA minimum of 8 years relevant experience. Atleast 2-3 end-to-end SAP Payroll implementations including at least one large scale end-to-end SAP Payroll. Hands-on experience in the following areas: - Payroll Control Center (PCC) configuration - HRSP upgrades and year-end activities - BSI tax factory configuration and maintenance - Wage type setup - SCHEMA, PCRs & Taxes for US & CA - Garnishments configuration - Finance posting - Payment models - Taxability setup - Remuneration statement. Experience in year-end activities. Experience in both Agile and Waterfall project methodologies and tasks required during each phase of implementation. Experience in working in a blended delivery model for greenfield and brownfield implementations and operations support. Experience with mid-year/mid-quarter payroll go-live.About Walmart Global TechImagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That's what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We're a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world's leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.Flexible, Hybrid WorkWe use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives.BenefitsBenefits: Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.Equal Opportunity EmployerWalmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer - By Choice. title: Power System Operations Engineer III/Senior
job_description: MISO offers a comprehensive benefits package available on your first day of employment.Position Location: Little Rock, ARAre you an electrical engineer looking to make an impact in a control room that oversees the reliable operations of an electric grid serving 45 million people?Do you have interest in working in a fast-paced environment where you will be interacting with a cross-section of internal and external groups, to ensure reliable and efficient delivery of electricity?Do you want to help manage the ever-evolving Eastern Interconnect through the paradigm changes of decarbonization, digitization, and decentralization?If so, read on…As our Power System Operations Engineer III/Senior, you will be part of MISO’s Real Time Operations group…where the “rubber meets the road.” Our operators and engineers work collaboratively to make complex and quick decisions. This team coordinates the use of the transmission system by ensuring flows stay within prescribed limits and partners with transmission operators and neighboring reliability coordinators to maintain reliability.As the Power System Operations Engineer III/Senior, you will be part of the team that works collaboratively with Reliability Coordinators and our stakeholders to enable reliable delivery of low-cost energy.You will also be responsible for working on engineering study automation projects, innovative engineering solutions for operations of the future and cross functional collaborative projects.In one year as our Power System Operations Engineer III/Senior, you will know you were successful if you have a basic understanding of the MISO footprint, are confident in your use of the suite of real time engineering tools and have established relationships with operators and external/internal stakeholders.We are looking for hardworking engineers who have: At least a Bachelor’s degree in any of the following:Electrical EngineeringComputer EngineeringElectrical Engineering TechnologyElectrical and Computer EngineeringElectrical and Electronic EngineeringElectronics and Computer Engineering Technology T he ability and willingness to work a 12-hour rotating shift schedule At least three years of utility, transmission operations, real-time operations, or related experienceWe would also prefer engineers with the following: Transient/Voltage stability experience Energy Management System experienceAppropriate level will be determined based upon experience and knowledge.See what MISO is all about!MISO manages the electricity superhighway in the Central U.S. Through use of groundbreaking research and advanced technology, our highly skilled employees ensure power flows reliably to 45 million people. Operating the electricity grid, running a robust energy market, planning for a bright future – it’s what our immensely talented and dedicated team does every day.For more info about MISO, check us out on YouTubeMISO 90 SecondsApply today for this great opportunity to help us keep the lights on!

title: Principal, Data Scientist (Pricing)
job_description: Position Summary...What you'll do...Walmart Global Tech is seeking a talented and experienced Principal Data Scientist specializing in Pricing Algorithms to lead our efforts in developing sophisticated pricing models and strategies . As a Principal Data Scientist , you will play a critical role in driving innovation and optimizing revenue through the application of advanced statistical and machine learning techniques. You will lead a team of data scientists and collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to develop and implement pricing algorithms that maximize profitability and drive business growth.About TeamOur Merchandise AI Team within Applied AI group is the driving force behind our retail and e-commerce success, leveraging cutting-edge AI and machine learning techniques to optimize every aspect of our merchandising strategy. With a diverse blend of expertise in statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and retail operations , our team pioneers innovative solutions across the merchandising lifecycle, from demand forecasting and assortment planning to pricing optimization. We're dedicated to building algorithms that empower stakeholders throughout the organization to make informed, data-driven decisions, ensuring that we stay ahead of the curve in an ever-evolving retail landscape.What You'll DoStrategic Leadership: Provide strategic leadership and technical expertise in the development and implementation of pricing algorithms and models. Define the vision, roadmap, and priorities for pricing optimization initiatives. Algorithm Development: Lead the design, development, and deployment of advanced pricing algorithms using state-of-the-art machine learning techniques, including but not limited to regression analysis, demand forecasting, dynamic pricing, and reinforcement learning. Code Review: Conduct thorough code reviews of pricing algorithms and related software components developed by the team. Ensure adherence to best practices, coding standards, and optimization techniques. Provide constructive feedback and mentorship to team members to enhance code quality and maintainability. Data Analysis and Insights: Utilize large datasets to conduct in-depth analysis of customer behavior, market dynamics, and competitive pricing strategies. Extract actionable insights to inform pricing decisions and strategy formulation. Model Evaluation and Optimization: Oversee the evaluation, validation, and optimization of pricing models to ensure accuracy, reliability, and performance. Implement rigorous testing methodologies to assess model effectiveness and robustness. Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including product management, engineering, marketing, and finance to understand business objectives, requirements, and constraints. Work collaboratively to translate business needs into data-driven pricing solutions. Thought Leadership: Stay abreast of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in pricing analytics, data science, and machine learning. Provide thought leadership and guidance on pricing strategy, methodologies, and implementation best practices. Documentation and Communication: Document methodologies, findings, and recommendations in clear and concise manner. Communicate complex technical concepts and insights to non-technical stakeholders through presentations, reports, and dashboards. Mentorship and Knowledge Sharing: Mentor junior team members and provide guidance on technical and methodological aspects of pricing analytics and data science. Foster a culture of learning and knowledge sharing within the team. What You'll BringPh.D. or equivalent advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field.Extensive experience (8+ years) in data science, machine learning, and statistical analysis, with a focus on pricing optimization.Proven track record of building and deploying pricing algorithms/models in a real-world setting .Expertise in programming languages such as Python, R, or Scala for data analysis and model development.Strong understanding of pricing concepts, methodologies, and strategies in diverse industries.Deep knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques, with hands-on experience in applying them to pricing problems.Excellent communication and leadership skills with the ability to influence and inspire cross-functional teams.Demonstrated ability to drive projects from conception to completion in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.About Walmart Global TechImagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That's what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We're a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world's leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs.
